ApplicationSetTemplateMeta represents the Argo CD application fields that may be used for Applications generated from the ApplicationSet (based on metav1.ObjectMeta)

ApplicationSetTerminalGenerator represents a generator nested within a nested generator (for example, a list within a merge within a matrix). A generator at this level may not be a combination-type generator (MatrixGenerator or MergeGenerator). ApplicationSet enforces this nesting depth limit because CRDs do not support recursive types. https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/controller-tools/issues/477

Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.MatrixGenera.description: MatrixGenerator generates the cartesian product of two sets of parameters. The parameters are defined by two nested generators.

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.MergeGenerat.description:
MergeGenerator merges the output of two or more generators. Where the values for all specified merge keys are equal between two sets of generated parameters, the parameter sets will be merged with the parameters from the latter generator taking precedence. Parameter sets with merge keys not present in the base generator's params will be ignored. For example, if the first generator produced [{a: '1', b: '2'}, {c: '1', d: '1'}] and the second generator produced [{'a': 'override'}], the united parameters for merge keys = ['a'] would be [{a: 'override', b: '1'}, {c: '1', d: '1'}].

MergeGenerator supports template overriding. If a MergeGenerator is one of multiple top-level generators, its template will be merged with the top-level generator before the parameters are applied.

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.NestedMatrix.description:
NestedMatrixGenerator is a MatrixGenerator nested under another combination-type generator (MatrixGenerator or MergeGenerator). NestedMatrixGenerator does not have an override template, because template overriding has no meaning within the constituent generators of combination-type generators.

NOTE: Nested matrix generator is not included directly in the CRD struct, instead it is included as a generic 'apiextensionsv1.JSON' object, and then marshalled into a NestedMatrixGenerator when processed.

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.NestedMergeG.description:
NestedMergeGenerator is a MergeGenerator nested under another combination-type generator (MatrixGenerator or MergeGenerator). NestedMergeGenerator does not have an override template, because template overriding has no meaning within the constituent generators of combination-type generators.

NOTE: Nested merge generator is not included directly in the CRD struct, instead it is included as a generic 'apiextensionsv1.JSON' object, and then marshalled into a NestedMergeGenerator when processed.

repo.description: Repo contains the URL to the remote repository

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.RepositoryCe.description: A RepositoryCertificate is either SSH known hosts entry or TLS certificate

group.description: Group specifies the API group of the resource

hookPhase.description: HookPhase contains the state of any operation associated with this resource OR hook This can also contain values for non-hook resources.

hookType.description: HookType specifies the type of the hook. Empty for non-hook resources

kind.description: Kind specifies the API kind of the resource

message.description: Message contains an informational or error message for the last sync OR operation

revision.description: Revision holds the revision the sync was performed against

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.RevisionMeta.description: RevisionMetadata contains metadata for a specific revision in a Git repository

message.description: Message contains the message associated with the revision, most likely the commit message.

signatureInfo.description: SignatureInfo contains a hint on the signer if the revision was signed with GPG, and signature verification is enabled.

tags.description: Tags specifies any tags currently attached to the revision Floating tags can move from one revision to another

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.SyncOperatio.description: SyncOperation contains details about a sync operation.

dryRun.description: DryRun specifies to perform a `kubectl apply --dry-run` without actually performing the sync

manifests.description: Manifests is an optional field that overrides sync source with a local directory for development

prune.description: Prune specifies to delete resources from the cluster that are no longer tracked in git

resources.description: Resources describes which resources shall be part of the sync

revision.description: Revision is the revision (Git) or chart version (Helm) which to sync the application to If omitted, will use the revision specified in app spec.

revisions.description: Revisions is the list of revision (Git) or chart version (Helm) which to sync each source in sources field for the application to If omitted, will use the revision specified in app spec.

source.description: Source overrides the source definition set in the application. This is typically set in a Rollback operation and is nil during a Sync operation

sources.description: Sources overrides the source definition set in the application. This is typically set in a Rollback operation and is nil during a Sync operation

syncOptions.description: SyncOptions provide per-sync sync-options, e.g. Validate=false

syncStrategy.description: SyncStrategy describes how to perform the sync

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.SyncOperatio.description: SyncOperationResult represent result of sync operation

managedNamespaceMetadata.description: ManagedNamespaceMetadata contains the current sync state of managed namespace metadata

resources.description: Resources contains a list of sync result items for each individual resource in a sync operation

revision.description: Revision holds the revision this sync operation was performed to

revisions.description: Revisions holds the revision this sync operation was performed for respective indexed source in sources field

source.description: Source records the application source information of the sync, used for comparing auto-sync

sources.description: Source records the application source information of the sync, used for comparing auto-sync

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.SyncPolicy.description: SyncPolicy controls when a sync will be performed in response to updates in git

automated.description: Automated will keep an application synced to the target revision

managedNamespaceMetadata.description: ManagedNamespaceMetadata controls metadata in the given namespace (if CreateNamespace=true)

retry.description: Retry controls failed sync retry behavior

syncOptions.description: Options allow you to specify whole app sync-options

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.SyncPolicyAu.description: SyncPolicyAutomated controls the behavior of an automated sync

allowEmpty.description: AllowEmpty allows apps have zero live resources (default: false)

prune.description: Prune specifies whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync (default: false)

selfHeal.description: SelfHeal specifies whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster (default: false)

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.SyncStatus.description: SyncStatus contains information about the currently observed live and desired states of an application

comparedTo.description: ComparedTo contains information about what has been compared

revision.description: Revision contains information about the revision the comparison has been performed to

revisions.description: Revisions contains information about the revisions of multiple sources the comparison has been performed to

status.description: Status is the sync state of the comparison

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.SyncStrategy.description: SyncStrategy controls the manner in which a sync is performed

apply.description: Apply will perform a `kubectl apply` to perform the sync.

hook.description: Hook will submit any referenced resources to perform the sync. This is the default strategy

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.SyncStrategy.description: SyncStrategyApply uses `kubectl apply` to perform the apply

force.description: Force indicates whether or not to supply the --force flag to `kubectl apply`. The --force flag deletes and re-create the resource, when PATCH encounters conflict and has retried for 5 times.

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.SyncStrategy.description: SyncStrategyHook will perform a sync using hooks annotations. If no hook annotation is specified falls back to `kubectl apply`.

force.description: Force indicates whether or not to supply the --force flag to `kubectl apply`. The --force flag deletes and re-create the resource, when PATCH encounters conflict and has retried for 5 times.

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.SyncWindow.description: SyncWindow contains the kind, time, duration and attributes that are used to assign the syncWindows to apps

applications.description: Applications contains a list of applications that the window will apply to

clusters.description: Clusters contains a list of clusters that the window will apply to

duration.description: Duration is the amount of time the sync window will be open

kind.description: Kind defines if the window allows or blocks syncs

manualSync.description: ManualSync enables manual syncs when they would otherwise be blocked

namespaces.description: Namespaces contains a list of namespaces that the window will apply to

schedule.description: Schedule is the time the window will begin, specified in cron format

timeZone.description: TimeZone of the sync that will be applied to the schedule

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.TLSClientCon.description: TLSClientConfig contains settings to enable transport layer security

caData.description: CAData holds PEM-encoded bytes (typically read from a root certificates bundle). CAData takes precedence over CAFile

certData.description: CertData holds PEM-encoded bytes (typically read from a client certificate file). CertData takes precedence over CertFile

insecure.description: Insecure specifies that the server should be accessed without verifying the TLS certificate. For testing only.

keyData.description: KeyData holds PEM-encoded bytes (typically read from a client certificate key file). KeyData takes precedence over KeyFile

serverName.description: ServerName is passed to the server for SNI and is used in the client to check server certificates against. If ServerName is empty, the hostname used to contact the server is used.

io.argoproj.argocd.v1alpha1.objectMeta.description: objectMeta and corresponding GetMetadata() methods is a hack to allow us to use grpc-gateway side-by-side with k8s protobuf codegen. The grpc-gateway generated .gw.pb.go files expect a GetMetadata() method to be generated because it assumes the .proto files were generated from protoc --go_out=plugins=grpc. Instead, kubernetes uses go-to-protobuf to generate .proto files from go types, and this method is not auto-generated (presumably since ObjectMeta is embedded but is nested in the 'metadata' field in JSON form).

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.BusConfig.description: BusConfig has the finalized configuration for EventBus

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.ContainerT.description: ContainerTemplate defines customized spec for a container

imagePullPolicy.description:
Possible enum values:
 - `"Always"` means that kubelet always attempts to pull the latest image. Container will fail If the pull fails.
 - `"IfNotPresent"` means that kubelet pulls if the image isn't present on disk. Container will fail if the image isn't present and the pull fails.
 - `"Never"` means that kubelet never pulls an image, but only uses a local image. Container will fail if the image isn't present

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.JetStreamB.description: JetStreamBus holds the JetStream EventBus information

affinity.description: The pod's scheduling constraints More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/assign-pod-node/

containerTemplate.description: ContainerTemplate contains customized spec for Nats JetStream container

imagePullSecrets.description: ImagePullSecrets is an optional list of references to secrets in the same namespace to use for pulling any of the images used by this PodSpec. If specified, these secrets will be passed to individual puller implementations for them to use. For example, in the case of docker, only DockerConfig type secrets are honored. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

maxPayload.description: Maximum number of bytes in a message payload, 0 means unlimited. Defaults to 1MB

metadata.description: Metadata sets the pods's metadata, i.e. annotations and labels

metricsContainerTemplate.description: MetricsContainerTemplate contains customized spec for metrics container

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the pod to fit on a node. Selector which must match a node's labels for the pod to be scheduled on that node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/assign-pod-node/

priority.description: The priority value. Various system components use this field to find the priority of the Redis pod. When Priority Admission Controller is enabled, it prevents users from setting this field. The admission controller populates this field from PriorityClassName. The higher the value, the higher the priority. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/pod-priority-preemption/

priorityClassName.description: If specified, indicates the Redis pod's priority. "system-node-critical" and "system-cluster-critical" are two special keywords which indicate the highest priorities with the former being the highest priority. Any other name must be defined by creating a PriorityClass object with that name. If not specified, the pod priority will be default or zero if there is no default. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/pod-priority-preemption/

reloaderContainerTemplate.description: ReloaderContainerTemplate contains customized spec for config reloader container

replicas.description: JetStream StatefulSet size

securityContext.description: SecurityContext holds pod-level security attributes and common container settings. Optional: Defaults to empty.  See type description for default values of each field.

serviceAccountName.description: ServiceAccountName to apply to the StatefulSet

settings.description: JetStream configuration, if not specified, global settings in controller-config will be used. See https://docs.nats.io/running-a-nats-service/configuration#jetstream. Only configure "max_memory_store" or "max_file_store", do not set "store_dir" as it has been hardcoded.

startArgs.description: Optional arguments to start nats-server. For example, "-D" to enable debugging output, "-DV" to enable debugging and tracing. Check https://docs.nats.io/ for all the available arguments.

streamConfig.description: Optional configuration for the streams to be created in this JetStream service, if specified, it will be merged with the default configuration in controller-config. It accepts a YAML format configuration, available fields include, "maxBytes", "maxMsgs", "maxAge" (e.g. 72h), "replicas" (1, 3, 5), "duplicates" (e.g. 5m).

url.description: JetStream (Nats) URL

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.KafkaBus.description: KafkaBus holds the KafkaBus EventBus information

sasl.description: SASL configuration for the kafka client

tls.description: TLS configuration for the kafka client.

url.description: URL to kafka cluster, multiple URLs separated by comma

version.description: Kafka version, sarama defaults to the oldest supported stable version

rebalanceStrategy.description: Rebalance strategy can be one of: sticky, roundrobin, range. Range is the default.

startOldest.description: When starting up a new group do we want to start from the oldest event (true) or the newest event (false), defaults to false

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.NATSBus.description: NATSBus holds the NATS eventbus information

exotic.description: Exotic holds an exotic NATS config

native.description: Native means to bring up a native NATS service

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.NATSConfig.description: NATSConfig holds the config of NATS

url.description: NATS streaming url

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.NativeStra.description: NativeStrategy indicates to install a native NATS service

affinity.description: The pod's scheduling constraints More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/assign-pod-node/

containerTemplate.description: ContainerTemplate contains customized spec for NATS container

imagePullSecrets.description: ImagePullSecrets is an optional list of references to secrets in the same namespace to use for pulling any of the images used by this PodSpec. If specified, these secrets will be passed to individual puller implementations for them to use. For example, in the case of docker, only DockerConfig type secrets are honored. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

maxAge.description: Max Age of existing messages, i.e. "72h", 4h35m

maxBytes.description: Total size of messages per channel, 0 means unlimited. Defaults to 1GB

maxMsgs.description: Maximum number of messages per channel, 0 means unlimited. Defaults to 1000000

maxPayload.description: Maximum number of bytes in a message payload, 0 means unlimited. Defaults to 1MB

maxSubs.description: Maximum number of subscriptions per channel, 0 means unlimited. Defaults to 1000

metadata.description: Metadata sets the pods's metadata, i.e. annotations and labels

metricsContainerTemplate.description: MetricsContainerTemplate contains customized spec for metrics container

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the pod to fit on a node. Selector which must match a node's labels for the pod to be scheduled on that node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/assign-pod-node/

priority.description: The priority value. Various system components use this field to find the priority of the EventSource pod. When Priority Admission Controller is enabled, it prevents users from setting this field. The admission controller populates this field from PriorityClassName. The higher the value, the higher the priority. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/pod-priority-preemption/

priorityClassName.description: If specified, indicates the EventSource pod's priority. "system-node-critical" and "system-cluster-critical" are two special keywords which indicate the highest priorities with the former being the highest priority. Any other name must be defined by creating a PriorityClass object with that name. If not specified, the pod priority will be default or zero if there is no default. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/pod-priority-preemption/

raftCommitTimeout.description: Specifies the time without an Apply() operation before sending an heartbeat to ensure timely commit, i.e. "72h", 4h35m. Defaults to 100ms

raftElectionTimeout.description: Specifies the time in candidate state without a leader before attempting an election, i.e. "72h", 4h35m. Defaults to 2s

raftHeartbeatTimeout.description: Specifies the time in follower state without a leader before attempting an election, i.e. "72h", 4h35m. Defaults to 2s

raftLeaseTimeout.description: Specifies how long a leader waits without being able to contact a quorum of nodes before stepping down as leader, i.e. "72h", 4h35m. Defaults to 1s

replicas.description: Size is the NATS StatefulSet size

securityContext.description: SecurityContext holds pod-level security attributes and common container settings. Optional: Defaults to empty.  See type description for default values of each field.

serviceAccountName.description: ServiceAccountName to apply to NATS StatefulSet

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.Persistenc.description: PersistenceStrategy defines the strategy of persistence

accessMode.description:
Available access modes such as ReadWriteOnce, ReadWriteMany https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#access-modes

Possible enum values:
 - `"ReadOnlyMany"` can be mounted in read-only mode to many hosts
 - `"ReadWriteMany"` can be mounted in read/write mode to many hosts
 - `"ReadWriteOnce"` can be mounted in read/write mode to exactly 1 host
 - `"ReadWriteOncePod"` can be mounted in read/write mode to exactly 1 pod cannot be used in combination with other access modes

storageClassName.description: Name of the StorageClass required by the claim. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#class-1

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.AMQPCon.description: AMQPConsumeConfig holds the configuration to immediately starts delivering queued messages

autoAck.description: AutoAck when true, the server will acknowledge deliveries to this consumer prior to writing the delivery to the network

consumerTag.description: ConsumerTag is the identity of the consumer included in every delivery

exclusive.description: Exclusive when true, the server will ensure that this is the sole consumer from this queue

noLocal.description: NoLocal flag is not supported by RabbitMQ

noWait.description: NowWait when true, do not wait for the server to confirm the request and immediately begin deliveries

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.AMQPEve.description: AMQPEventSource refers to an event-source for AMQP stream events

auth.description: Auth hosts secret selectors for username and password

connectionBackoff.description: Backoff holds parameters applied to connection.

consume.description: Consume holds the configuration to immediately starts delivering queued messages For more information, visit https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/rabbitmq/amqp091-go#Channel.Consume

exchangeDeclare.description: ExchangeDeclare holds the configuration for the exchange on the server For more information, visit https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/rabbitmq/amqp091-go#Channel.ExchangeDeclare

exchangeName.description: ExchangeName is the exchange name For more information, visit https://www.rabbitmq.com/tutorials/amqp-concepts.html

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

queueBind.description: QueueBind holds the configuration that binds an exchange to a queue so that publishings to the exchange will be routed to the queue when the publishing routing key matches the binding routing key For more information, visit https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/rabbitmq/amqp091-go#Channel.QueueBind

queueDeclare.description: QueueDeclare holds the configuration of a queue to hold messages and deliver to consumers. Declaring creates a queue if it doesn't already exist, or ensures that an existing queue matches the same parameters For more information, visit https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/rabbitmq/amqp091-go#Channel.QueueDeclare

tls.description: TLS configuration for the amqp client.

url.description: URL for rabbitmq service

urlSecret.description: URLSecret is secret reference for rabbitmq service URL

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.AMQPExc.description: AMQPExchangeDeclareConfig holds the configuration for the exchange on the server

autoDelete.description: AutoDelete removes the exchange when no bindings are active

durable.description: Durable keeps the exchange also after the server restarts

internal.description: Internal when true does not accept publishings

noWait.description: NowWait when true does not wait for a confirmation from the server

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.AMQPQue.description: AMQPQueueBindConfig holds the configuration that binds an exchange to a queue so that publishings to the exchange will be routed to the queue when the publishing routing key matches the binding routing key

noWait.description: NowWait false and the queue could not be bound, the channel will be closed with an error

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.AMQPQue.description: AMQPQueueDeclareConfig holds the configuration of a queue to hold messages and deliver to consumers. Declaring creates a queue if it doesn't already exist, or ensures that an existing queue matches the same parameters

arguments.description: Arguments of a queue (also known as "x-arguments") used for optional features and plugins

autoDelete.description: AutoDelete removes the queue when no consumers are active

durable.description: Durable keeps the queue also after the server restarts

exclusive.description: Exclusive sets the queues to be accessible only by the connection that declares them and will be deleted wgen the connection closes

name.description: Name of the queue. If empty the server auto-generates a unique name for this queue

noWait.description: NowWait when true, the queue assumes to be declared on the server

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.AzureEv.description: AzureEventsHubEventSource describes the event source for azure events hub More info at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/event-hubs/

fqdn.description: FQDN of the EventHubs namespace you created More info at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/event-hubs/event-hubs-get-connection-string

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

sharedAccessKey.description: SharedAccessKey is the generated value of the key

sharedAccessKeyName.description: SharedAccessKeyName is the name you chose for your application's SAS keys

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.AzureQu.description: AzureQueueStorageEventSource describes the event source for azure queue storage more info at https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/queues/

connectionString.description: ConnectionString is the connection string to access Azure Queue Storage. If this fields is not provided it will try to access via Azure AD with StorageAccountName.

decodeMessage.description: DecodeMessage specifies if all the messages should be base64 decoded. If set to true the decoding is done before the evaluation of JSONBody

dlq.description: DLQ specifies if a dead-letter queue is configured for messages that can't be processed successfully. If set to true, messages with invalid payload won't be acknowledged to allow to forward them farther to the dead-letter queue. The default value is false.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

queueName.description: QueueName is the name of the queue

storageAccountName.description: StorageAccountName is the name of the storage account where the queue is. This field is necessary to access via Azure AD (managed identity) and it is ignored if ConnectionString is set.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.AzureSe.description: AzureServiceBusEventSource describes the event source for azure service bus More info at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/service-bus-messaging/

connectionString.description: ConnectionString is the connection string for the Azure Service Bus. If this fields is not provided it will try to access via Azure AD with DefaultAzureCredential and FullyQualifiedNamespace.

fullyQualifiedNamespace.description: FullyQualifiedNamespace is the Service Bus namespace name (ex: myservicebus.servicebus.windows.net). This field is necessary to access via Azure AD (managed identity) and it is ignored if ConnectionString is set.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

queueName.description: QueueName is the name of the Azure Service Bus Queue

subscriptionName.description: SubscriptionName is the name of the Azure Service Bus Topic Subscription

tls.description: TLS configuration for the service bus client

topicName.description: TopicName is the name of the Azure Service Bus Topic

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Bitbuck.description: BitbucketAuth holds the different auth strategies for connecting to Bitbucket

oauthToken.description: OAuthToken refers to the K8s secret that holds the OAuth Bearer token.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Bitbuck.description: BasicAuth holds the information required to authenticate user via basic auth mechanism

password.description: Password refers to the K8s secret that holds the password.

username.description: Username refers to the K8s secret that holds the username.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Bitbuck.description: BitbucketEventSource describes the event source for Bitbucket

auth.description: Auth information required to connect to Bitbucket.

deleteHookOnFinish.description: DeleteHookOnFinish determines whether to delete the defined Bitbucket hook once the event source is stopped.

events.description: Events this webhook is subscribed to.

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will be passed along the event payload.

owner.description: DeprecatedOwner is the owner of the repository. Deprecated: use Repositories instead. Will be unsupported in v1.9

projectKey.description: DeprecatedProjectKey is the key of the project to which the repository relates Deprecated: use Repositories instead. Will be unsupported in v1.9

repositories.description: Repositories holds a list of repositories for which integration needs to set up

repositorySlug.description: DeprecatedRepositorySlug is a URL-friendly version of a repository name, automatically generated by Bitbucket for use in the URL Deprecated: use Repositories instead. Will be unsupported in v1.9

webhook.description: Webhook refers to the configuration required to run an http server

owner.description: Owner is the owner of the repository

repositorySlug.description: RepositorySlug is a URL-friendly version of a repository name, automatically generated by Bitbucket for use in the URL

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Bitbuck.description: BitbucketServerEventSource refers to event-source related to Bitbucket Server events

accessToken.description: AccessToken is reference to K8s secret which holds the bitbucket api access information

bitbucketserverBaseURL.description: BitbucketServerBaseURL is the base URL for API requests to a custom endpoint

deleteHookOnFinish.description: DeleteHookOnFinish determines whether to delete the Bitbucket Server hook for the project once the event source is stopped.

events.description: Events are bitbucket event to listen to. Refer https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/event-payload-938025882.html

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

projectKey.description: DeprecatedProjectKey is the key of project for which integration needs to set up Deprecated: use Repositories instead. Will be unsupported in v1.8

repositories.description: Repositories holds a list of repositories for which integration needs to set up

repositorySlug.description: DeprecatedRepositorySlug is the slug of the repository for which integration needs to set up Deprecated: use Repositories instead. Will be unsupported in v1.8

tls.description: TLS configuration for the bitbucketserver client.

webhook.description: Webhook holds configuration to run a http server

webhookSecret.description: WebhookSecret is reference to K8s secret which holds the bitbucket webhook secret (for HMAC validation)

projectKey.description: ProjectKey is the key of project for which integration needs to set up

repositorySlug.description: RepositorySlug is the slug of the repository for which integration needs to set up

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Calenda.description: CalendarEventSource describes a time based dependency. One of the fields (schedule, interval, or recurrence) must be passed. Schedule takes precedence over interval; interval takes precedence over recurrence

exclusionDates.description: ExclusionDates defines the list of DATE-TIME exceptions for recurring events.

interval.description: Interval is a string that describes an interval duration, e.g. 1s, 30m, 2h...

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

persistence.description: Persistence hold the configuration for event persistence

schedule.description: Schedule is a cron-like expression. For reference, see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron

timezone.description: Timezone in which to run the schedule

enabled.description: Enabled enables to triggered the missed schedule when eventsource restarts

createIfNotExist.description: CreateIfNotExist will create configmap if it doesn't exists

name.description: Name of the configmap

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Emitter.description: EmitterEventSource describes the event source for emitter More info at https://emitter.io/develop/getting-started/

channelKey.description: ChannelKey refers to the channel key

channelName.description: ChannelName refers to the channel name

connectionBackoff.description: Backoff holds parameters applied to connection.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

password.description: Password to use to connect to broker

tls.description: TLS configuration for the emitter client.

username.description: Username to use to connect to broker

catchup.description: Catchup enables to triggered the missed schedule when eventsource restarts

configMap.description: ConfigMap holds configmap details for persistence

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.EventSo.description: EventSource is the definition of a eventsource resource

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.EventSo.description: EventSourceList is the list of eventsource resources

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.EventSo.description: EventSourceSpec refers to specification of event-source resource

eventBusName.description: EventBusName references to a EventBus name. By default the value is "default"

replicas.description: Replicas is the event source deployment replicas

service.description: Service is the specifications of the service to expose the event source

template.description: Template is the pod specification for the event source

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.EventSo.description: EventSourceStatus holds the status of the event-source resource

conditions.description: Conditions are the latest available observations of a resource's current state.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.FileEve.description: FileEventSource describes an event-source for file related events.

eventType.description: Type of file operations to watch Refer https://github.com/fsnotify/fsnotify/blob/master/fsnotify.go for more information

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

watchPathConfig.description: WatchPathConfig contains configuration about the file path to watch

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Generic.description: GenericEventSource refers to a generic event source. It can be used to implement a custom event source.

authSecret.description: AuthSecret holds a secret selector that contains a bearer token for authentication

config.description: Config is the event source configuration

insecure.description: Insecure determines the type of connection.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

url.description: URL of the gRPC server that implements the event source.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.GerritE.description: GerritEventSource refers to event-source related to gerrit events

auth.description: Auth hosts secret selectors for username and password

deleteHookOnFinish.description: DeleteHookOnFinish determines whether to delete the Gerrit hook for the project once the event source is stopped.

events.description: Events are gerrit event to listen to. Refer https://gerrit-review.googlesource.com/Documentation/cmd-stream-events.html#events

gerritBaseURL.description: GerritBaseURL is the base URL for API requests to a custom endpoint

hookName.description: HookName is the name of the webhook

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

projects.description: List of project namespace paths like "whynowy/test".

webhook.description: Webhook holds configuration to run a http server

appID.description: AppID refers to the GitHub App ID for the application you created

installationID.description: InstallationID refers to the Installation ID of the GitHub app you created and installed

privateKey.description: PrivateKey refers to a K8s secret containing the GitHub app private key

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.GithubE.description: GithubEventSource refers to event-source for github related events

active.description: Active refers to status of the webhook for event deliveries. https://developer.github.com/webhooks/creating/#active

apiToken.description: APIToken refers to a K8s secret containing github api token

deleteHookOnFinish.description: DeleteHookOnFinish determines whether to delete the GitHub hook for the repository once the event source is stopped.

events.description: Events refer to Github events to which the event source will subscribe

githubApp.description: GitHubApp holds the GitHub app credentials

id.description: Id is the webhook's id Deprecated: This is not used at all, will be removed in v1.6

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

organizations.description: Organizations holds the names of organizations (used for organization level webhooks). Not required if Repositories is set.

owner.description: DeprecatedOwner refers to GitHub owner name i.e. argoproj Deprecated: use Repositories instead. Will be unsupported in v 1.6

repositories.description: Repositories holds the information of repositories, which uses repo owner as the key, and list of repo names as the value. Not required if Organizations is set.

repository.description: DeprecatedRepository refers to GitHub repo name i.e. argo-events Deprecated: use Repositories instead. Will be unsupported in v 1.6

webhook.description: Webhook refers to the configuration required to run a http server

webhookSecret.description: WebhookSecret refers to K8s secret containing GitHub webhook secret https://developer.github.com/webhooks/securing/

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.GitlabE.description: GitlabEventSource refers to event-source related to Gitlab events

accessToken.description: AccessToken references to k8 secret which holds the gitlab api access information

deleteHookOnFinish.description: DeleteHookOnFinish determines whether to delete the GitLab hook for the project once the event source is stopped.

events.description: Events are gitlab event to listen to. Refer https://github.com/xanzy/go-gitlab/blob/bf34eca5d13a9f4c3f501d8a97b8ac226d55e4d9/projects.go#L794.

gitlabBaseURL.description: GitlabBaseURL is the base URL for API requests to a custom endpoint

groups.description: List of group IDs or group name like "test". Group level hook available in Premium and Ultimate Gitlab.

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

projectID.description: DeprecatedProjectID is the id of project for which integration needs to setup Deprecated: use Projects instead. Will be unsupported in v 1.7

projects.description: List of project IDs or project namespace paths like "whynowy/test". Projects and groups cannot be empty at the same time.

secretToken.description: SecretToken references to k8 secret which holds the Secret Token used by webhook config

webhook.description: Webhook holds configuration to run a http server

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.HDFSEve.description: HDFSEventSource refers to event-source for HDFS related events

checkInterval.description: CheckInterval is a string that describes an interval duration to check the directory state, e.g. 1s, 30m, 2h... (defaults to 1m)

hdfsUser.description: HDFSUser is the user to access HDFS file system. It is ignored if either ccache or keytab is used.

krbCCacheSecret.description: KrbCCacheSecret is the secret selector for Kerberos ccache Either ccache or keytab can be set to use Kerberos.

krbConfigConfigMap.description: KrbConfig is the configmap selector for Kerberos config as string It must be set if either ccache or keytab is used.

krbKeytabSecret.description: KrbKeytabSecret is the secret selector for Kerberos keytab Either ccache or keytab can be set to use Kerberos.

krbRealm.description: KrbRealm is the Kerberos realm used with Kerberos keytab It must be set if keytab is used.

krbServicePrincipalName.description: KrbServicePrincipalName is the principal name of Kerberos service It must be set if either ccache or keytab is used.

krbUsername.description: KrbUsername is the Kerberos username used with Kerberos keytab It must be set if keytab is used.

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

path.description: Path is relative path of object to watch with respect to the directory

pathRegexp.description: PathRegexp is regexp of relative path of object to watch with respect to the directory

type.description: Type of file operations to watch

groupName.description: The name for the consumer group to use

oldest.description: When starting up a new group do we want to start from the oldest event (true) or the newest event (false), defaults to false

rebalanceStrategy.description: Rebalance strategy can be one of: sticky, roundrobin, range. Range is the default.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.KafkaEv.description: KafkaEventSource refers to event-source for Kafka related events

config.description:
Yaml format Sarama config for Kafka connection. It follows the struct of sarama.Config. See https://github.com/IBM/sarama/blob/main/config.go e.g.

consumer:
  fetch:
    min: 1
net:
  MaxOpenRequests: 5

connectionBackoff.description: Backoff holds parameters applied to connection.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

limitEventsPerSecond.description: Sets a limit on how many events get read from kafka per second.

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

sasl.description: SASL configuration for the kafka client

tls.description: TLS configuration for the kafka client.

url.description: URL to kafka cluster, multiple URLs separated by comma

version.description: Specify what kafka version is being connected to enables certain features in sarama, defaults to 1.0.0

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.MQTTEve.description: MQTTEventSource refers to event-source for MQTT related events

auth.description: Auth hosts secret selectors for username and password

clientId.description: ClientID is the id of the client

connectionBackoff.description: ConnectionBackoff holds backoff applied to connection.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the mqtt client.

url.description: URL to connect to broker

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.NATSAut.description: NATSAuth refers to the auth info for NATS EventSource

basic.description: Baisc auth with username and password

connectionBackoff.description: ConnectionBackoff holds backoff applied to connection.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

subject.description: Subject holds the name of the subject onto which messages are published

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.NSQEven.description: NSQEventSource describes the event source for NSQ PubSub More info at https://godoc.org/github.com/nsqio/go-nsq

connectionBackoff.description: Backoff holds parameters applied to connection.

hostAddress.description: HostAddress is the address of the host for NSQ lookup

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.PubSubE.description: PubSubEventSource refers to event-source for GCP PubSub related events.

credentialSecret.description: CredentialSecret references to the secret that contains JSON credentials to access GCP. If it is missing, it implicitly uses Workload Identity to access. https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/workload-identity

deleteSubscriptionOnFinish.description: DeleteSubscriptionOnFinish determines whether to delete the GCP PubSub subscription once the event source is stopped.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

projectID.description: ProjectID is GCP project ID for the subscription. Required if you run Argo Events outside of GKE/GCE. (otherwise, the default value is its project)

subscriptionID.description: SubscriptionID is ID of subscription. Required if you use existing subscription. The default value will be auto generated hash based on this eventsource setting, so the subscription might be recreated every time you update the setting, which has a possibility of event loss.

topic.description: Topic to which the subscription should belongs. Required if you want the eventsource to create a new subscription. If you specify this field along with an existing subscription, it will be verified whether it actually belongs to the specified topic.

topicProjectID.description: TopicProjectID is GCP project ID for the topic. By default, it is same as ProjectID.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.PulsarE.description: PulsarEventSource describes the event source for Apache Pulsar

authAthenzParams.description: Authentication athenz parameters for the pulsar client. Refer https://github.com/apache/pulsar-client-go/blob/master/pulsar/auth/athenz.go Either token or athenz can be set to use auth.

authAthenzSecret.description: Authentication athenz privateKey secret for the pulsar client. AuthAthenzSecret must be set if AuthAthenzParams is used.

authTokenSecret.description: Authentication token for the pulsar client. Either token or athenz can be set to use auth.

connectionBackoff.description: Backoff holds parameters applied to connection.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the pulsar client.

tlsAllowInsecureConnection.description: Whether the Pulsar client accept untrusted TLS certificate from broker.

tlsValidateHostname.description: Whether the Pulsar client verify the validity of the host name from broker.

topics.description: Name of the topics to subscribe to.

type.description: Type of the subscription. Only "exclusive" and "shared" is supported. Defaults to exclusive.

url.description: Configure the service URL for the Pulsar service.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.RedisEv.description: RedisEventSource describes an event source for the Redis PubSub. More info at https://godoc.org/github.com/go-redis/redis#example-PubSub

db.description: DB to use. If not specified, default DB 0 will be used.

hostAddress.description: HostAddress refers to the address of the Redis host/server

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

namespace.description: Namespace to use to retrieve the password from. It should only be specified if password is declared

password.description: Password required for authentication if any.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the redis client.

username.description: Username required for ACL style authentication if any.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.RedisSt.description: RedisStreamEventSource describes an event source for Redis streams (https://redis.io/topics/streams-intro)

consumerGroup.description: ConsumerGroup refers to the Redis stream consumer group that will be created on all redis streams. Messages are read through this group. Defaults to 'argo-events-cg'

db.description: DB to use. If not specified, default DB 0 will be used.

hostAddress.description: HostAddress refers to the address of the Redis host/server (master instance)

maxMsgCountPerRead.description: MaxMsgCountPerRead holds the maximum number of messages per stream that will be read in each XREADGROUP of all streams Example: if there are 2 streams and MaxMsgCountPerRead=10, then each XREADGROUP may read upto a total of 20 messages. Same as COUNT option in XREADGROUP(https://redis.io/topics/streams-intro). Defaults to 10

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

password.description: Password required for authentication if any.

streams.description: Streams to look for entries. XREADGROUP is used on all streams using a single consumer group.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the redis client.

username.description: Username required for ACL style authentication if any.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Resourc.description: ResourceEventSource refers to a event-source for K8s resource related events.

eventTypes.description: EventTypes is the list of event type to watch. Possible values are - ADD, UPDATE and DELETE.

filter.description: Filter is applied on the metadata of the resource If you apply filter, then the internal event informer will only monitor objects that pass the filter.

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

namespace.description: Namespace where resource is deployed

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Resourc.description: ResourceFilter contains K8s ObjectMeta information to further filter resource event objects

afterStart.description: If the resource is created after the start time then the event is treated as valid.

createdBy.description: If resource is created before the specified time then the event is treated as valid.

fields.description: Fields provide field filters similar to K8s field selector (see https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/field-selectors/). Unlike K8s field selector, it supports arbitrary fileds like "spec.serviceAccountName", and the value could be a string or a regex. Same as K8s field selector, operator "=", "==" and "!=" are supported.

labels.description: Labels provide listing options to K8s API to watch resource/s. Refer https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/label-selectors/ for more info. Unlike K8s field selector, multiple values are passed as comma separated values instead of list of values. Eg: value: value1,value2. Same as K8s label selector, operator "=", "==", "!=", "exists", "!", "notin", "in", "gt" and "lt" are supported

prefix.description: Prefix filter is applied on the resource name.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.SFTPEve.description: SFTPEventSource describes an event-source for sftp related events.

eventType.description: Type of file operations to watch Refer https://github.com/fsnotify/fsnotify/blob/master/fsnotify.go for more information

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

password.description: Password required for authentication if any.

pollIntervalDuration.description: PollIntervalDuration the interval at which to poll the SFTP server defaults to 10 seconds

sshKeySecret.description: SSHKeySecret refers to the secret that contains SSH key

username.description: Username required for authentication if any.

watchPathConfig.description: WatchPathConfig contains configuration about the file path to watch

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.SNSEven.description: SNSEventSource refers to event-source for AWS SNS related events

accessKey.description: AccessKey refers K8s secret containing aws access key

endpoint.description: Endpoint configures connection to a specific SNS endpoint instead of Amazons servers

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

roleARN.description: RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume.

secretKey.description: SecretKey refers K8s secret containing aws secret key

validateSignature.description: ValidateSignature is boolean that can be set to true for SNS signature verification

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.SQSEven.description: SQSEventSource refers to event-source for AWS SQS related events

accessKey.description: AccessKey refers K8s secret containing aws access key

dlq.description: DLQ specifies if a dead-letter queue is configured for messages that can't be processed successfully. If set to true, messages with invalid payload won't be acknowledged to allow to forward them farther to the dead-letter queue. The default value is false.

endpoint.description: Endpoint configures connection to a specific SQS endpoint instead of Amazons servers

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

queue.description: Queue is AWS SQS queue to listen to for messages

queueAccountId.description: QueueAccountID is the ID of the account that created the queue to monitor

roleARN.description: RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume.

secretKey.description: SecretKey refers K8s secret containing aws secret key

sessionToken.description: SessionToken refers to K8s secret containing AWS temporary credentials(STS) session token

waitTimeSeconds.description: WaitTimeSeconds is The duration (in seconds) for which the call waits for a message to arrive in the queue before returning.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Selecto.description: Selector represents conditional operation to select K8s objects.

operation.description: Supported operations like ==, != etc. Defaults to ==. Refer https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors for more info.

value.description: Value

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Service.description: Service holds the service information eventsource exposes

clusterIP.description: clusterIP is the IP address of the service and is usually assigned randomly by the master. If an address is specified manually and is not in use by others, it will be allocated to the service; otherwise, creation of the service will fail. This field can not be changed through updates. Valid values are "None", empty string (""), or a valid IP address. "None" can be specified for headless services when proxying is not required. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#virtual-ips-and-service-proxies

ports.description: The list of ports that are exposed by this ClusterIP service.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.SlackEv.description: SlackEventSource refers to event-source for Slack related events

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

webhook.description: Webhook holds configuration for a REST endpoint

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Storage.description: StorageGridEventSource refers to event-source for StorageGrid related events

apiURL.description: APIURL is the url of the storagegrid api.

bucket.description: Name of the bucket to register notifications for.

filter.description: Filter on object key which caused the notification.

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

webhook.description: Webhook holds configuration for a REST endpoint

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Storage.description: StorageGridFilter represents filters to apply to bucket notifications for specifying constraints on objects

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.StripeE.description: StripeEventSource describes the event source for stripe webhook notifications More info at https://stripe.com/docs/webhooks

apiKey.description: APIKey refers to K8s secret that holds Stripe API key. Used only if CreateWebhook is enabled.

createWebhook.description: CreateWebhook if specified creates a new webhook programmatically.

eventFilter.description: EventFilter describes the type of events to listen to. If not specified, all types of events will be processed. More info at https://stripe.com/docs/api/events/list

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

webhook.description: Webhook holds configuration for a REST endpoint

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Templat.description: Template holds the information of an EventSource deployment template

affinity.description: If specified, the pod's scheduling constraints

container.description: Container is the main container image to run in the event source pod

imagePullSecrets.description: ImagePullSecrets is an optional list of references to secrets in the same namespace to use for pulling any of the images used by this PodSpec. If specified, these secrets will be passed to individual puller implementations for them to use. For example, in the case of docker, only DockerConfig type secrets are honored. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

metadata.description: Metadata sets the pods's metadata, i.e. annotations and labels

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the pod to fit on a node. Selector which must match a node's labels for the pod to be scheduled on that node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/assign-pod-node/

priority.description: The priority value. Various system components use this field to find the priority of the EventSource pod. When Priority Admission Controller is enabled, it prevents users from setting this field. The admission controller populates this field from PriorityClassName. The higher the value, the higher the priority. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/pod-priority-preemption/

priorityClassName.description: If specified, indicates the EventSource pod's priority. "system-node-critical" and "system-cluster-critical" are two special keywords which indicate the highest priorities with the former being the highest priority. Any other name must be defined by creating a PriorityClass object with that name. If not specified, the pod priority will be default or zero if there is no default. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/pod-priority-preemption/

securityContext.description: SecurityContext holds pod-level security attributes and common container settings. Optional: Defaults to empty.  See type description for default values of each field.

serviceAccountName.description: ServiceAccountName is the name of the ServiceAccount to use to run event source pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-service-account/

volumes.description: Volumes is a list of volumes that can be mounted by containers in an eventsource.

path.description: Path is relative path of object to watch with respect to the directory

pathRegexp.description: PathRegexp is regexp of relative path of object to watch with respect to the directory

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Webhook.description: WebhookContext holds a general purpose REST API context

authSecret.description: AuthSecret holds a secret selector that contains a bearer token for authentication

maxPayloadSize.description: MaxPayloadSize is the maximum webhook payload size that the server will accept. Requests exceeding that limit will be rejected with "request too large" response. Default value: 1048576 (1MB).

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

method.description: Method is HTTP request method that indicates the desired action to be performed for a given resource. See RFC7231 Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Semantics and Content

port.description: Port on which HTTP server is listening for incoming events.

serverCertSecret.description: ServerCertPath refers the file that contains the cert.

serverKeySecret.description: ServerKeyPath refers the file that contains private key

url.description: URL is the url of the server.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Webhook.description: CalendarEventSource describes an HTTP based EventSource

authSecret.description: AuthSecret holds a secret selector that contains a bearer token for authentication

maxPayloadSize.description: MaxPayloadSize is the maximum webhook payload size that the server will accept. Requests exceeding that limit will be rejected with "request too large" response. Default value: 1048576 (1MB).

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

method.description: Method is HTTP request method that indicates the desired action to be performed for a given resource. See RFC7231 Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Semantics and Content

port.description: Port on which HTTP server is listening for incoming events.

serverCertSecret.description: ServerCertPath refers the file that contains the cert.

serverKeySecret.description: ServerKeyPath refers the file that contains private key

url.description: URL is the url of the server.

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.ALBTraffic.description: ALBTrafficRouting configuration for ALB ingress controller to control traffic routing

annotationPrefix.description: AnnotationPrefix has to match the configured annotation prefix on the alb ingress controller

ingress.description: Ingress refers to the name of an `Ingress` resource in the same namespace as the `Rollout`

ingresses.description: Ingresses refers to the name of an `Ingress` resource in the same namespace as the `Rollout` in a multi ingress scenario

rootService.description: RootService references the service in the ingress to the controller should add the action to

servicePort.description: ServicePort refers to the port that the Ingress action should route traffic to

stickinessConfig.description: StickinessConfig refers to the duration-based stickiness of the target groups associated with an `Ingress`

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.Ambassador.description: AmbassadorTrafficRouting defines the configuration required to use Ambassador as traffic router

mappings.description: Mappings refer to the name of the Ambassador Mappings used to route traffic to the service

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.AnalysisRu.description: AnalysisRun is an instantiation of an AnalysisTemplate

Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. name.description: Name argument name

value.description: Value a hardcoded value for the argument. This field is a one of field with valueFrom

valueFrom.description: ValueFrom A reference to where the value is stored. This field is a one of field with valueFrom

annotations.description: Annotations additional annotations to add to the AnalysisRun

labels.description: Labels Additional labels to add to the AnalysisRun

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.AnalysisRu.description: AnalysisRunSpec is the spec for a AnalysisRun resource

args.description: Args are the list of arguments used in this run

dryRun.description: DryRun object contains the settings for running the analysis in Dry-Run mode

measurementRetention.description: MeasurementRetention object contains the settings for retaining the number of measurements during the analysis

metrics.description: Metrics contains the list of metrics to query as part of an analysis run

terminate.description: Terminate is used to prematurely stop the run (e.g. rollout completed and analysis is no longer desired)

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.AnalysisRu.description: AnalysisRunStatus is the status for a AnalysisRun resource

dryRunSummary.description: DryRunSummary contains the final results from the metric executions in the dry-run mode

message.description: Message is a message explaining current status

metricResults.description: MetricResults contains the metrics collected during the run

phase.description: Phase is the status of the analysis run

runSummary.description: RunSummary contains the final results from the metric executions

startedAt.description: StartedAt indicates when the analysisRun first started

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.AnalysisRu.description: AnalysisRunStrategy configuration for the analysis runs and experiments to retain

successfulRunHistoryLimit.description: SuccessfulRunHistoryLimit limits the number of old successful analysis runs and experiments to be retained in a history

unsuccessfulRunHistoryLimit.description: UnsuccessfulRunHistoryLimit limits the number of old unsuccessful analysis runs and experiments to be retained in a history. Stages for unsuccessful: "Error", "Failed", "Inconclusive"

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.AnalysisTe.description: AnalysisTemplate holds the template for performing canary analysis

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.AnalysisTe.description: AnalysisTemplateSpec is the specification for a AnalysisTemplate resource

args.description: Args are the list of arguments to the template

dryRun.description: DryRun object contains the settings for running the analysis in Dry-Run mode

measurementRetention.description: MeasurementRetention object contains the settings for retaining the number of measurements during the analysis

metrics.description: Metrics contains the list of metrics to query as part of an analysis run

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.AntiAffini.description: AntiAffinity defines which inter-pod scheduling rule to use for anti-affinity injection

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.ApisixRout.description: ApisixRoute holds information on the APISIX Route the rollout needs to modify

name.description: Name refer to the name of the APISIX Route used to route traffic to the service

rules.description: RuleRef a list of the APISIX Route HTTP Rules used to route traffic to the service

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.ApisixTraf.description: ApisixTrafficRouting defines the configuration required to use APISIX as traffic router

route.description: Route references an Apisix Route to modify to shape traffic

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.AppMeshTra.description: AppMeshTrafficRouting configuration for AWS AppMesh service mesh to enable fine grain configuration

virtualNodeGroup.description: VirtualNodeGroup references an AppMesh Route targets that are formed by a set of VirtualNodes that are used to shape traffic

virtualService.description: VirtualService references an AppMesh VirtualService and VirtualRouter to modify to shape traffic

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.AppMeshVir.description: AppMeshVirtualNodeGroup holds information about targets used for routing traffic to a virtual service

canaryVirtualNodeRef.description: CanaryVirtualNodeRef is the virtual node ref to modify labels with canary ReplicaSet pod template hash value

stableVirtualNodeRef.description: StableVirtualNodeRef is the virtual node name to modify labels with stable ReplicaSet pod template hash value

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.AppMeshVir.description: AppMeshVirtualNodeReference holds a reference to VirtualNode.appmesh.k8s.aws

name.description: Name is the name of VirtualNode CR

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.AppMeshVir.description: AppMeshVirtualService holds information on the virtual service the rollout needs to modify

name.description: Name is the name of virtual service

routes.description: Routes is list of HTTP routes within virtual router associated with virtual service to edit. If omitted, virtual service must have a single route of this type.

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.Argument.description: Argument is an argument to an AnalysisRun

name.description: Name is the name of the argument

value.description: Value is the value of the argument

valueFrom.description: ValueFrom is a reference to where a secret is stored. This field is one of the fields with valueFrom

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.ArgumentVa.description: ArgumentValueFrom defines references to fields within resources to grab for the value (i.e. Pod Template Hash)

podTemplateHashValue.description: PodTemplateHashValue gets the value from one of the children ReplicaSet's Pod Template Hash

fullName.description: FullName is the full name of the resource

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.BlueGreenS.description: BlueGreenStatus status fields that only pertain to the blueGreen rollout

activeSelector.description: ActiveSelector indicates which replicas set the active service is serving traffic to

postPromotionAnalysisRunStatus.description: PostPromotionAnalysisRunStatus indicates the status of the current post promotion analysis run

prePromotionAnalysisRunStatus.description: PrePromotionAnalysisRunStatus indicates the status of the current prepromotion analysis run

previewSelector.description: PreviewSelector indicates which replicas set the preview service is serving traffic to

scaleUpPreviewCheckPoint.description: ScaleUpPreviewCheckPoint indicates that the Replicaset receiving traffic from the preview service is ready to be scaled up after the rollout is unpaused

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.BlueGreenS.description: BlueGreenStrategy defines parameters for Blue Green deployment

abortScaleDownDelaySeconds.description: AbortScaleDownDelaySeconds adds a delay in second before scaling down the preview replicaset if update is aborted. 0 means not to scale down. Default is 30 second

activeMetadata.description: ActiveMetadata specify labels and annotations which will be attached to the active pods for the duration which they act as a active pod, and will be removed after

activeService.description: Name of the service that the rollout modifies as the active service.

antiAffinity.description: AntiAffinity enables anti-affinity rules for Blue Green deployment

autoPromotionEnabled.description: AutoPromotionEnabled indicates if the rollout should automatically promote the new ReplicaSet to the active service or enter a paused state. If not specified, the default value is true.

autoPromotionSeconds.description: AutoPromotionSeconds is a duration in seconds in which to delay auto-promotion (default: 0). The countdown begins after the preview ReplicaSet have reached full availability. This option is ignored if autoPromotionEnabled is set to false.

maxUnavailable.description: MaxUnavailable The maximum number of pods that can be unavailable during a restart operation. Defaults to 25% of total replicas.

postPromotionAnalysis.description: PostPromotionAnalysis configuration to run analysis after a selector switch

prePromotionAnalysis.description: PrePromotionAnalysis configuration to run analysis before a selector switch

previewMetadata.description: PreviewMetadata specify labels and annotations which will be attached to the preview pods for the duration which they act as a preview pod, and will be removed after

previewReplicaCount.description: PreviewReplicaCount is the number of replicas to run for the preview stack before the switchover. Once the rollout is resumed the desired replicaset will be full scaled up before the switch occurs

previewService.description: Name of the service that the rollout modifies as the preview service.

scaleDownDelayRevisionLimit.description: ScaleDownDelayRevisionLimit limits the number of old RS that can run at one time before getting scaled down

scaleDownDelaySeconds.description: ScaleDownDelaySeconds adds a delay before scaling down the previous replicaset. If omitted, the Rollout waits 30 seconds before scaling down the previous ReplicaSet. A minimum of 30 seconds is recommended to ensure IP table propagation across the nodes in a cluster. See https://github.com/argoproj/argo-rollouts/issues/19#issuecomment-476329960 for more information

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.CanaryStat.description: CanaryStatus status fields that only pertain to the canary rollout

currentBackgroundAnalysisRunStatus.description: CurrentBackgroundAnalysisRunStatus indicates the status of the current background analysis run

currentStepAnalysisRunStatus.description: CurrentStepAnalysisRunStatus indicates the status of the current step analysis run

stablePingPong.description: StablePingPong For the ping-pong feature holds the current stable service, ping or pong

weights.description: Weights records the weights which have been set on traffic provider. Only valid when using traffic routing

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.CanaryStep.description: CanaryStep defines a step of a canary deployment.

analysis.description: Analysis defines the AnalysisRun that will run for a step

experiment.description: Experiment defines the experiment object that should be created

pause.description: Pause freezes the rollout by setting spec.Paused to true. A Rollout will resume when spec.Paused is reset to false.

setCanaryScale.description: SetCanaryScale defines how to scale the newRS without changing traffic weight

setHeaderRoute.description: SetHeaderRoute defines the route with specified header name to send 100% of traffic to the canary service

setMirrorRoute.description: SetMirrorRoutes Mirrors traffic that matches rules to a particular destination

setWeight.description: SetWeight sets what percentage of the newRS should receive

io.argoproj.rollouts.v1alpha1.CanaryStra.description: CanaryStrategy defines parameters for a Replica Based Canary

abortScaleDownDelaySeconds.description: AbortScaleDownDelaySeconds adds a delay in second before scaling down the canary pods when update is aborted for canary strategy with traffic routing (not applicable for basic canary). 0 means canary pods are not scaled down. Default is 30 seconds.

analysis.description: Analysis runs a separate analysisRun while all the steps execute. This is intended to be a continuous validation of the new ReplicaSet

antiAffinity.description: AntiAffinity enables anti-affinity rules for Canary deployment

canaryMetadata.description: CanaryMetadata specify labels and annotations which will be attached to the canary pods for the duration which they act as a canary, and will be removed after

canaryService.description: CanaryService holds the name of a service which selects pods with canary version and don't select any pods with stable version.

dynamicStableScale.description: DynamicStableScale is a traffic routing feature which dynamically scales the stable ReplicaSet to minimize total pods which are running during an update. This is calculated by scaling down the stable as traffic is increased to canary. When disabled (the default behavior) the stable ReplicaSet remains fully scaled to support instantaneous aborts.

maxSurge.description: MaxSurge The maximum number of pods that can be scheduled above the original number of pods. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of total pods at the start of the update (ex: 10%). This can not be 0 if MaxUnavailable is 0. Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding up. By default, a value of 25% is used. Example: when this is set to 30%, the new RC can be scaled up by 30% immediately when the rolling update starts. Once old pods have been killed, new RC can be scaled up further, ensuring that total number of pods running at any time during the update is at most 130% of original pods.

maxUnavailable.description: MaxUnavailable The maximum number of pods that can be unavailable during the update. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of total pods at the start of update (ex: 10%). Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding down. This can not be 0 if MaxSurge is 0. By default, a fixed value of 25% is used. Example: when this is set to 30%, the old RC can be scaled down by 30% immediately when the rolling update starts. Once new pods are ready, old RC can be scaled down further, followed by scaling up the new RC, ensuring that at least 70% of original number of pods are available at all times during the update.

minPodsPerReplicaSet.description: Assuming the desired number of pods in a stable or canary ReplicaSet is not zero, then make sure it is at least MinPodsPerReplicaSet for High Availability. Only applicable for TrafficRoutedCanary

pingPong.description: PingPongSpec holds the ping and pong services

scaleDownDelayRevisionLimit.description: ScaleDownDelayRevisionLimit limits the number of old RS that can run at one time before getting scaled down

scaleDownDelaySeconds.description: ScaleDownDelaySeconds adds a delay before scaling down the previous ReplicaSet when the canary strategy is used with traffic routing (default 30 seconds). A delay in scaling down the previous ReplicaSet is needed after switching the stable service selector to point to the new ReplicaSet, in order to give time for traffic providers to re-target the new pods. This value is ignored with basic, replica-weighted canary without traffic routing.
